page.title: 13St. JOSEPH'S R.C. SCHOOL
page.content: Coundon St. Joseph's R.C. school was begun in 1905 and completed in 1907. At first it was an all age school from five to fourteen. When you were 11 years old you had to take a test to go to a grammar school. After the 1939-45 war the leaving age went up to fifteen and soon there were over 250 children. In 1962 new classrooms and toilets were built and the allotments nearby were converted to a playing field. In 1964 a new secondary school was built in Bishop Auckland and St. Joseph's became an Infant and Junior School. There have been seven headteachers. The last was Mr. McGowan who was head for 28 years. The head is now Mrs. Mc.Manners. There are three teachers, Mr. Sharkey, Miss Brown and Miss Spellman. The school had it's Diamond Jubilee in 1982.
